Reason

Unit test will search the class containing @SpringBootApplication and load this class as application context.

The search algorithm works up from the package that contains the test until it finds a @SpringBootApplication or @SpringBootConfiguration annotated class. As long as youâ€™ve structure your code in a sensible way your main configuration is usually found.

http://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/1.4.0.M3/reference/htmlsingle/# boot-features-testing-spring-boot-applications-detecting-config

Solution

Use @SpringBootApplication instead of:

@Configuration
@EnableAutoConfiguration
@ComponentScan
